brief_description of the content in the: The source URL provides information about a common issue in RESTful Web Services where methods annotated with @GET do not return anything. According to the source, methods annotated with @GET must have a non-void return type.
generated_rule_explanation from GPT-4: The rule 'voidMethodAnnotatedWithGET' checks all classes and their methods. If a method is annotated with @GET, it asserts that the return type of the method is not void. If the return type is void, it generates a message indicating the method and class where this issue occurs.
new_built-in_functions_explanation if an: The rule uses the following built-in functions: getClasses, getMethods, hasAnnotation, getReturnType, getName, getFQN. No new functions were introduced.
3rd-party most relevant URLs and summary:
1. https://www.baeldung.com/jax-rs-response: This page from Baeldung discusses how to properly use the @GET annotation in JAX-RS. It emphasizes that methods annotated with @GET should return a Response object, not void.
2. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20193003/how-to-return-nothing-with-a-get-restful-service-method: This StackOverflow thread discusses the issue of methods returning void in a RESTful service. The consensus is that it's not good practice for a method with a @GET annotation to return void.
